item.nzh-sem:metakeywords: National, Rotorua Daily Post, Bay of Plenty Times, Coronavirus, Politics, NZ Government
item.title: Jacinda Ardern's wriggle room on moving to alert level 1 early
item.description:
Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has left the door ajar to move the country into alert level 1 in less than four weeks.
But she and health chief Ashley Bloomfield are warning about the "long tail" of Covid-19 ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202022/SCCZEN_280520NZHMTBLOOMFIELD4_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Director general of health Ashley Bloomfield says Covid-19 has a long tail and that's why New Zealand should remain at alert level 2. Photo / Mark Tantrum

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202022/SCCZEN_270520POOLCOVID12_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says that Cabinet will meet no later than on June 22 to consider whether the country is ready for alert level 1. Photo / Pool

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202022/SCCZEN_280520POOLWINSTON6_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Deputy Prime Minister Winston Peters wants New Zealand to be at level 1, some transtasman flights to be operating now, and for exemptions to be given to international students to return. Photo / Pool

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202022/SCCZEN_A_HBT121167-02_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Social gatherings, including weddings, will be able to have up to 100 people from midday today. Photo / Paul Taylor
